HelpXML.Title: HApsix
HelpXML.Purpose: HApsix computes psi function using Hampel proposal times x

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: ctuning
Item.LongDesc: Scalar or vector of length 4 which specifies the value of the tuning constant c (scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator) and the prefixed values of paramters a, b, c ctuning(1) = tuning constant which will multiply parameters a, b and c of Hampel rho (psi) function ctuning(2) = paramter a of Hampel rho (psi) function ctuning(3) = paramter b of Hampel rho (psi) function ctuning(4) = paramter c of Hampel rho (psi) function Remark: if length(ctuning)==1 values of a, b and c will be set to a=2*ctuning b=4*ctuning c=4*ctuning With these choices, if ctuning=1 the resulting influence function is nearly identical to the biweight with parameter 8.

Item.Name: psiHAx
Item.TypeInd: Values of Hampel psi(u)*u function associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample.

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function HApsix transforms vector u as follows
\[ HApsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u^2 & |u| <= a \\ a \times sign(u)u & a <= |u| < b \\ a \frac{c-|u|}{c-b} \times sign(u)\times u & b <= |u| < c \\ 0 & |u| >= c \end{array} \right. \]
where $a$= ctuning(2) *ctuning(1). $b$= ctuning(3) *ctuning(1). $c$= ctuning(4) *ctuning(1).
The default (if input ctuning is a scalar) is $a$= 2*ctuning. $b$= 4*ctuning. $c$= 8*ctuning.
It is necessary to have 0 <= $a$ <= $b$ <= $c$

References.Item: D. C. Hoaglin, F. Mosteller, J. W. Tukey (1982), Understanding Robust and Exploratory Data Analysis Wiley, New York.

Item.Title: Obtain bottom panel of Figure 11.10.
Item.MATLABcode: %% Obtain bottom panel of Figure 11.10. % p. 375 of Hoaglin et al. (1987) x=-9:0.1:9; psiHAx=HApsix(x,1); plot(x,psiHAx) xlabel('x','Interpreter','Latex') ylabel(' Hampel $\psi(x) \times x $','Interpreter','Latex')
